text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with garlic noodles that's right
i'm gonna show you how to make San
Francisco style garlic noodles which I'd
have to say is one of our lesser-known
local delicacies and while this is
usually served as a side dish for garlic
roasted crab it would pair perfectly
with pretty much any other main course
or as I'll be enjoying it today all by
itself so with that let's go ahead and
get started and we'll begin with our
secret sauce and for that what we're
gonna need is some soy sauce and not the
low-sodium kind okay we're gonna need
that sodium we're also going to need
some oyster sauce and if you're not sure
what that is I'll explain in the blog
post and then we will also drizzle in a
little bit of Worcestershire sauce as
well as its distant cousin Asian fish
sauce which I always feel like I have to
remind people tastes like a hundred
times better than it smells and then we
will finish up with just a little touch
of sesame oil as well as the obligatory
shake of cayenne and that's it we will
give that a stir with our freakishly
small wooden spoon and as soon as that
is mixed our secret sauce is done
although once everybody sees the video
we're gonna have to come up with a
different name for the sauce and then
besides that very savory solution we're
also gonna need a ton of finely minced
or crushed garlic as well as some butter
to saute it in and believe it or not a
little bit of freshly and finely grated
Parmesan cheese and then last but not
least a little bit of sliced green onion
to garnish the top and by the way since
this recipe comes together so quickly we
are probably gonna want to prep all that
stuff before we head to the stove
which reminds me let's head to the stove
where we're gonna melt our butter in a
skillet set over medium heat and what
we'll do as soon as that butter melts
and starts to bubble it's carefully at
our garlic and we'll cook that stirring
for just about one minute okay we
basically just want to take off the ROG
we do not want this to brown so like I
said we will stir that around for about
one minute a fair warning it is gonna
smell insanely good and then you may
have heard the old saying keep your
friends close your enemies closer
and your secret sauce even closer than
that and the reason we want that sauce
right next to us is because as soon as
our garlic is sizzled for about a minute
and we think it's just right
go ahead and quickly stir that in which
will immediately stop the garlic from
cooking any further in the butter all
right so do not add the garlic to the
pan unless you can reach your sauce and
as soon as that's been stirred in we
will simply turn off the heat and
reserve that until needed in other words
until our noodles are cooked and by
noodles in my case I mean spaghetti
which I'm going to go ahead and add to
this very generously salted boiling
water and in case you're wondering if
other kind of noodles will work yes
every single one of them so if you want
to use some actual Chinese egg noodles
like the ones they use for chow mein or
maybe some ramen go for it I mean you
are after all the Alexander Graham Bell
of your garlic noodle so feel free to
experiment with different varieties but
personally a nice thick spaghetti is my
favorite but anyway we have our sauce in
the pan ready and waiting and our
noodles are boiling nearby oh and I
should mention we're not gonna drain the
pasta when it's ready I'm just gonna use
my tongs to fish it out like this and
add it to the pan directly because we
actually want a little bit of water
coming with it all in one tip here cook
the noodles all the way all right now
dente pasta really doesn't work as well
here so I cooked that spaghetti for the
full time until it was perfectly tender
at which point like I said we will fish
that out and add it directly to the pan
and the reason I'm doing it this way is
you can probably see a little bit of
water's coming with it which is very
important all right we want to keep
things nice and moist and what we'll do
here is toss those noodles in the sauce
until it's completely coated
at which point we'll stop and add our
cheese if we're using it and basically
as soon as that's all been stirred in we
are pretty much ready to serve and
remember just like virtually every pasta
noodle dish we make if we think things
are getting a little dry we can always
just add a little more that pasta water
into the pan which is what you see me
doing here and that's it once our
noodles have been successfully sauced we
can go ahead and plate up which I will
be doing in one of my two Asian style
bowls and then because this is maybe not
the most visually impressive dish ever I
do like to finish the top of the few red
chili flakes as well as some sliced
green onions and that's it our San
Francisco style garlic noodles are done
and if there was ever a recipe that
under promised and over delivered it's
this one
alright it might seem kind of simple and
not look that exciting but assuming you
enjoy garlic this is going to be one of
the best things you've ever eaten and it
actually reminds me of the Italian pasta
dish a Leo Lea and that it is so
deceptively simple yet profoundly
satisfying although I have to admit
thanks to our formerly secret sauce this
is actually much more savory and as I
mentioned earlier this is traditionally
served with a roasted garlic crab which
really is an incredible pairing but
these noodles would be just as good
paired with something like shrimp or
chicken or maybe even underneath a nice
pork chop but of course the true test of
any pasta noodle dish it has to be good
enough to eat on its own and this my
friends most certainly is and as you saw
this was very simple to put together and
extremely fast to make which is why I
really do hope you give this a try soon
so head over to food wishes comm for all
the ingredient amounts of more info as
usual and as always
[Music]
you
